snippet: Prepaid phone plans, where you pay the full price for a cellphone and then pay cheaper monthly rates without a contract, seem to offer what most budget-conscious people want. So why haven't they really caught on?
abstract: Prepaid phone plans, where you pay the full price for a cellphone and then pay cheaper monthly rates without a contract, seem to offer what most budget-conscious people want. So why haven't they really caught on?

headline.main: Prepaid Cellphones Are Cheaper. Why Aren't They Popular?
